Posts.Content: nanova wrote: The movie "Living Proof" about the testing and approval of herceptin is on Lifetime at 10PM tonight.  It's a really good movie (have tissues handy), especially if you're taking herceptin! Dx 7/27/2008, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 1/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: "Living Proof", herceptin story on tonight nanova nanova
Does chemo zap cancer in nodes... Lynette Maryiz

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 04:44AM - edited Oct 29, 2008 04:47AM by nanova Yes, the oncologist said that-  I specifically asked about the remaining lymph nodes and she said that it was the chemo's job to kill any remaining cancer cells in the nodes and the rest of the body.  The radiologist said we would also be zapping the first level of nodes when we do the breast.  When I talked to the surgeon after the pathology came back, I told him I wanted to keep my lymph nodes.  He said he agreed with me, but some doctors would have automatically said I had to have them taken out.  I was really relieved that the tumor review board said I could keep them!  If they had said I needed the second surgery, I'm not sure what I would have done. Nancy
Posts.Title: Does chemo zap cancer in nodes... Lynette Maryiz
